sen.j: 源義親の乱（みなもとのよしちかのらん）は平安時代中期に起きた反乱。
sen.e: The rebellion by MINAMOTO no Yoshichika was a rebellion which took place in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: 康和の乱、源義親追討事件などとも言われる。

sen.j: 源義家の子の源義親が九州で略奪を行い、官吏を殺したため、隠岐国へ流された。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshichika, son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie looted and killed a government official in Kyushu region, and was sent into exile in Oki Province.
MINAMOTO no Yoshichika, the son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie looted and killed a government official in Kyushu region, and was sent into exile in Oki Province.
sen.cmt: son の前に冠詞を加えました。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshichika, the son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie looted and killed a government official in Kyushu region, and was sent into exile in Oki Province.

sen.j: だが、義親は出雲国で再び目代を殺害して官物を奪う乱暴を働いた。
sen.e: However, Yoshichika committed violent actions again by killing the mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor) and plundered kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes) in Izumo Province.

However, Yoshichika committed violent actions again by killing the mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor) and plundered kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes) in Izumo Province.

sen.j: 父の義家の死後、白河法皇の起用により平正盛が派遣され義親は誅された。
sen.e: After the death of his father Yoshiie, TAIRA no Masamori appointed by the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa was dispatched and Yoshichika was killed.
After the death of his father Yoshiie, TAIRA no Masamori appointed by the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa was dispatched and Yoshichika was killed.
sen.cmt: TAIRA の前の空白を１半角分削除しました。
sen.e: After the death of his father Yoshiie, TAIRA no Masamori appointed by the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa was dispatched and Yoshichika was killed.

sen.j: 義親の首は京都で梟されたが、生存の噂が絶えず、その後、次々に「義親」を名乗る者が現れ、事件の余波は20年以上に渡って続いた。
sen.e: The head of Yoshichika was exposed to public scorn or ridicule in Kyoto, but the rumor of his living continued and a person calling himself 'Yoshichika' appeared one after another and the aftermath of this incident lasted more than 20 years.

The head of Yoshichika was exposed to public scorn or ridicule in Kyoto, but the rumor of his living continued and a person calling himself 'Yoshichika' appeared one after another and the aftermath of this incident lasted more than 20 years.

sen.j: 乱後に河内源氏では内訌が続き大きく凋落する。
sen.e: After the rebellion, the internal strife of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) continued and it lost traction seriously.
After the rebellion, the internal strife of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) continued and it lost traction seriously.

sen.j: 一方、平正盛による義親追討は伊勢平氏の台頭の契機となった。
sen.e: On the other hand, tracking down and killing Yoshichika by TAIRA no Masamori triggered the emergency of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).
On the other hand, tracking down and killing Yoshichika by TAIRA no Masamori triggered the emergence of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).
sen.cmt: 単語間違い： emergency → emergence に訂正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, tracking down and killing Yoshichika by TAIRA no Masamori triggered the emergence of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).

sen.j: 源義家は後三年の役で出羽清原氏と戦って勝利したが、朝廷は私戦として論功行賞を認めなかった。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshiie fight against the Dewa Kiyohara clan in Go Sannen no Eki (Later Three-Year Campaign) and won, but Chotei (Imperial Court) did not approve the grant of honors because it was shisen (private warfare).

MINAMOTO no Yoshiie fought against the Dewa Kiyohara clan in Go Sannen no Eki (Later Three-Year Campaign) and won, but Chotei (Imperial Court) did not approve the grant of honors because Chotei considered it was private warfare.
sen.cmt: 時制間違い： fight → fought に訂正しました。 「私戦」は特別な歴史用語ではないと考え、shisen (private warefare) → private warfare としました。また、実際に「私戦」かどうかを判断したのは朝廷なので、because の後にchotei considered を補いました。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshiie fought against the Dewa Kiyohara clan in Go Sannen no Eki (Later Three-Year Campaign) and won, but Chotei (Imperial Court) did not approve the grant of honors because Chotei considered it was private warfare.

sen.j: このため義家は従軍した軍士に私財をなげうって報償し、これによって東国武士、百姓の義家への尊崇は絶大なものになっていた。
sen.e: Because of this Yoshichiie rewarded the samurai participating in the campaign by offering personal assets, which raised the respect of Yoshiie by Togoku Samuraiand peasants enormously.
Accordingly, Yoshiie rewarded the samurai who had participated in the campaign by offering personal assets, by which Yoshiie earned the enormous respect of Togoku Samurai and peasants.
sen.cmt: より自然な英語にするため、Because of this → Accordingly に変更しました。スペルミス： Yoshichiie → Yoshiie に訂正しました。 時制を整えるため、participating → who had participated に訂正しました。 文法間違い： which raised the respect of Yoshiie では、義家が誰かを尊敬したことになってしまうので、に訂正しました。
sen.e: Accordingly, Yoshiie rewarded the samurai who had participated in the campaign by offering personal assets, by which Yoshiie earned the enormous respect of Togoku Samurai and peasants.

sen.j: 京都でも義家の威名は高まり「天下第一の武勇の士」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: The great fame of Yoshichiie heightened In Kyoto also, and he was called 'the No. 1 heroic samurai in the world'.
The great fame of Yoshiie heightened In Kyoto as well, and he was called 'the No. 1 heroic samurai in the world.'
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Yoshichiie → Yoshiie に訂正しました。 Also を語尾に置くのは口語的な感じがするので、 as well に変更しました。
sen.e: The great fame of Yoshiie heightened In Kyoto as well, and he was called 'the No. 1 heroic samurai in the world.'

sen.j: この頃は摂関政治に代わる院政の時代で、白河天皇が「治天の君」として専制権力を振っていた。
sen.e: It was in the period of Insei (rule by the retired Emperor) replacing the regency, and Emperor Shirakawa was exercising dictatorship as 'chiten no kimi' (the retired Emperor who organize politics).
It was time of Insei (rule by the retired Emperor) which replaced the regency, and Emperor Shirakawa was exercising dictatorship as 'chiten no kimi' (the retired Emperor in power).
sen.cmt: in the period of だと、例えば「江戸時代」などのような特定の時代のような印象を受けるので、time of に変更しました。 わかりやすくするため、replacing → which replaced に訂正しました。 「治天の君」の注釈に"who organize politics" とありますが、organize は3単現のs がつくべきではないでしょうか。念のため、登録用語中の別の訳に置き換えました。
sen.e: It was time of Insei (rule by the retired Emperor) which replaced the regency, and Emperor Shirakawa was exercising dictatorship as 'chiten no kimi' (the retired Emperor in power).

sen.j: 白河法皇は義家の武力を身辺警固に大いに活用する一方で、前陸奥国受領のまま昇進はさせず、あまつさえ寛治5年（1091年）には諸国の百姓に義家への田畑の寄進の禁止を命じる宣旨を出し、その力を抑え込もうとした。
sen.e: While the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa was utilizing Yoshiie's military power, he did not allow the promotion of Yoshichiie from zuryo (provincial governor) of Mutsu Province, and moreover he suppressed the power of Yoshiie by issuing the senji (imperial decree) prohibiting peasants in various districts to donate the fields to him in 1091.

While the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa was utilizing Yoshiie's military power to guard himself, he did not allow the promotion of Yoshiie from zuryo (provincial governor) of Mutsu Province, and moreover he tried to suppress the power of Yoshiie by issuing the senji (imperial decree) prohibiting peasants in various districts from donating the fields to Yoshiie in 1091.
sen.cmt: 訳抜け：「身辺警固に」に相当する部分の訳がなかったのでto guard himself と追加しました。 スペルミス： Yoshichiie → Yoshiie に訂正しました。 原文は「抑えた」ではなく「抑え込もうとした」ですので、suppressed → tried to suppress に訂正しました。 文法ミス： to donate → from donating に訂正しました。 最後のhim が誰かをはっきりさせるため、Yoshiie に訂正しました。
sen.e: While the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa was utilizing Yoshiie's military power to guard himself, he did not allow the promotion of Yoshiie from zuryo (provincial governor) of Mutsu Province, and moreover he tried to suppress the power of Yoshiie by issuing the senji (imperial decree) prohibiting peasants in various districts from donating the fields to Yoshiie in 1091.

sen.j: 一方で、法皇は義家の対抗馬を用意し、弟の源義綱を積極的に起用し、同7年（1093年）に出羽国で平師妙・平師季が叛乱を起こすと起用して鎮圧させ、義綱は師妙・師季の首を掲げ堂々行列して京都へ凱旋した。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Cloistered Emperor created Yoshichiie's rival by using his brother, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsuna positively and had him crush the insurrection by TAIRA no Morotae and TAIRA no Morosue in Dewa Province in 1093, which ended up Yoshitsuna's triumphal return to Kyoto parading proudly with the heads of Morotae and Morosue upheld.

On the other hand, the Cloistered Emperor created Yoshiie's rival by using his brother, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsuna positively and had him crush the insurrection by TAIRA no Morotae and TAIRA no Morosue in Dewa Province in 1093, which ended up Yoshitsuna's triumphal return to Kyoto parading proudly with the heads of Morotae and Morosue upheld.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Yoshichiie's → Yoshiie's に訂正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Cloistered Emperor created a rival to Yoshiie by making active use of his brother, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsuna, to crush the insurrection led by TAIRA no Morotae and TAIRA no Morosue in Dewa Province in 1093; the outcome of this saw Yoshitsuna return to Kyoto in triumph, proudly parading the severed heads of Morotae and Morosue.

sen.j: 義綱は賞により従四位下に叙せられ、美濃国守に任じられた。
sen.e: As a reward Yoshitsuna was given jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Mino no kuni no kami (Governor of Mino Province).
As a reward Yoshitsuna was given jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Mino no kuni no kami (Governor of Mino Province).
As a reward Yoshitsuna was given jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Mino no kuni no kami (Governor of Mino Province).

sen.j: この義綱と義家の仲は極めて険悪だった。
sen.e: Yoshichitsuna and Yoshiie were be at each others' throats.
Yoshitsuna and Yoshiie were at each other's throats.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Yoshichitsuna → Yoshitsuna に訂正しました。 文法ミス： were be → were、others' → other's に訂正しました。
sen.e: Yoshitsuna and Yoshiie were at each other's throats.

sen.j: それでも、義家の声望は依然として高く、承徳2年（1098年）法皇は義家に院の昇殿を許し、義家は感激したが、武士の身分を低く見る当時の公卿社会はこれすらも納得しない風潮だった。
sen.e: Nevertheless, Yoshiie maintained high reputation and the Cloistered Emperor allowed him access to the imperial court in 1098, with which he was moved, but the climate at that time was such that the Kugyo (high court noble) community which considered the social status of samurai to be low did not take it well.

Nevertheless, Yoshiie maintained high reputation and the Cloistered Emperor allowed him access to the imperial court in 1098, with which he was moved, but the climate at that time was such that the Kugyo (high court noble) community which considered the social status of samurai to be low did not take it well.

Nevertheless, Yoshiie maintained high reputation and the Cloistered Emperor allowed him access to the imperial court in 1098, with which he was moved, but the climate at that time was such that the Kugyo (high court noble) community which considered the social status of samurai to be low did not take it well.

tit.j: 源義親の横行と義家の死
tit.e: The rampancy of MINAMOTO no Yoshichika and the death of Yoshiie
The rampancy of MINAMOTO no Yoshichika and the death of Yoshiie
The rampancy of MINAMOTO no Yoshichika and the death of Yoshiie

sen.j: 義家の二男の義親は父譲りの剛勇で知られ、対馬国守に任じられて九州に赴任していたが、康和3年（1101年）大宰大弐大江匡房から義親が人民を殺し、略奪を行っているとの訴えが起こされた。
sen.e: Yoshichika, the second son of Yoshichika was known for his bravery inherited from his father went down to Kyushu as appointed as Tsushima no kuni no kami (Governor of Tsushima Province), but OE no Masafusa, then Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) charged that Yoshichika was killing people and looting in 1101.

Yoshichika, the second son of Yoshiie, and was known for his bravery inherited from his father, was assigned to Kyushu as Tsushima no kuni no kami (Governor of Tsushima Province), but OE no Masafusa, then Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) charged that Yoshichika was killing people and looting in 1101.
sen.cmt: 2番目のYoshichika は義家の間違いです。よって訂正しました。 文法ミス： 最初の部分の構造がおかしくなっています。したがって、Yoshiie と was の間に, and を加えて訂正しました。また、それに伴い、father の後にコンマを入れました。 went down to Kyushu as appointed as の部分をより自然な英語にするため、assigned を使って変更しました。
sen.e: Yoshichika, the second son of Yoshiie, and was known for his bravery inherited from his father, was assigned to Kyushu as Tsushima no kuni no kami (Governor of Tsushima Province), but OE no Masafusa, then Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) charged that Yoshichika was killing people and looting in 1101.

sen.j: 朝廷は追討を議し、まずは義家の郎党の豊後国権守藤原資道を派遣し、説得して召還を試みることになった。
sen.e: Chotei (Imperial Court) discussed on tracking down and killing Yoshiie, and decided to dispatch his roto (retainer), FUJIWARA no Sukemichi who was Bungo Province Gon no kami (provisional governor) and to persuade him to be recalled to Kyoto.

Chotei (Imperial Court) discussed whether to track down and kill Yoshiie, and decided to dispatch his roto (retainer), FUJIWARA no Sukemichi who was Gon no kami (provisional governor) of Bungo Province to persuade Yoshiie to return to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス： discussed on tracking → discussed whether to track に訂正しました。 Bungo Province Gon no kami はやや不自然な感じがするので、Gon no kami of Bungo Province に変更しました。 And to persuade him → to persuade Yoshiie に訂正しました。 やや不自然な印象があるので、to be recalled → to return に訂正しました。
sen.e: Chotei (Imperial Court) discussed whether to track down and kill Yoshiie, and decided to dispatch his roto (retainer), FUJIWARA no Sukemichi who was Gon no kami (provisional governor) of Bungo Province to persuade Yoshiie to return to Kyoto.

sen.j: ところが、現地に着いた資道は義親に従い官吏を殺してしまった。
sen.e: However, Sukemichi who arrived at the site obeyed Yoshichika and killed the government official.
However, Sukemichi who arrived at the site obeyed Yoshichika and killed the government official.
However, Sukemichi who arrived at the site obeyed Yoshichika and killed the government official.

sen.j: このため、翌同4年（1102年）12月、朝廷は義親を隠岐国へ流罪と決める。
sen.e: For this reason Chotei decided to deport Yoshichika to Oki Province on December in the following year, 1102.
For this reason Chotei decided to deport Yoshichika to Oki Province in December of the following year, 1102.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス： on December in the following year → in December of the following year に訂正しました。
sen.e: For this reason Chotei decided to deport Yoshichika to Oki Province in December of the following year, 1102.

sen.j: その後の動静は詳らかではなく、『大日本史』などは義親は配所には行かなかったとしている。
sen.e: His whereabout since then has been unclear, and it is written in "Dai-Nihon-shi" that Yoshichika did not go to the exile place.
His whereabout since then has been unclear, and it is written in "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan) that Yoshichika did not go to the exile place.
sen.cmt: 「大日本史」の訳を、登録されている定訳に置き換えました。
sen.e: His whereabout since then has been unclear, and it is written in "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan) that Yoshichika did not go to the exile place.

sen.j: 義親は出雲国へ渡り、目代を殺害して再び官物を奪う乱暴を働いた。
sen.e: Yoshichika went to Izumo Province and committed violent actions, killing mokudai and plundering kanmotsu once again.
Yoshichika went to Izumo Province and committed violent actions of killing mokudai and plundering kanmotsu once again.
sen.cmt: より自然な英語にするため、actions, killing の部分を actions of killing に訂正しました。
sen.e: Yoshichika went to Izumo Province and committed violent actions of killing mokudai and plundering kanmotsu once again.

sen.j: 義家の立場は苦しいものとなり、義家自らが子の義親追討に当たらねばならなくなった。
sen.e: Yoshiie's position became very difficult and he was forced to confront himself against killing tracking down and killing his son, Yoshiie.
This incident put Yoshiie in a very difficult position and he was forced to confront the task of tracking down his son Yoshichika and kill him.
sen.cmt: 息子の義親の訳がYoshiie となっていたり、"against killing tracking down and killing"の部分など、文法的にも訳が大きく間違っています。従って初めから大幅に訂正しました。
sen.e: This incident put Yoshiie in a very difficult position and he was forced to confront the task of tracking down his son Yoshichika and kill him.

sen.j: 嘉承元年（1106年）、常陸国でも三男の源義国と弟の源義光が合戦に及ぶ騒動を起こし（常陸合戦）、義家が京都への召還を命じている。
sen.e: In 1106 his third son, MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni and his younger brother MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu created a disturbance extending to a battle in Hitachi Province (Hitachi Battle) and Yoshiie recalled them to Kyoto.

In 1106 Yoshiie's third son, MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni and his younger brother MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu created a disturbance extending to a battle in Hitachi Province (Hitachi Battle) and Yoshiie recalled them to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくするため、his → Yoshiie's に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1106 Yoshiie's third son, MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni and his younger brother MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu created a disturbance extending to a battle in Hitachi Province (Hitachi Battle) and Yoshiie recalled them to Kyoto.

sen.j: このような一族が引き起こす騒擾のさなか、同年7月、義家は68歳で死去した。
sen.e: In the middle of the disorders which were created by his family, he died at the age of 68.
In the middle of the disorders which were created by his family, Yoshiie died at the age of 68 in July, 1106.
sen.cmt: 主語を明確にするため、he died → Yoshiie died に訂正しました。 訳漏れ：年号が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: In the middle of the disorders which were created by his family, Yoshiie died at the age of 68 in July, 1106.

tit.e: Tracking down and killing byTAIRA no Masamori
Tracking down and killing (of Yoshichika) byTAIRA no Masamori
tit.cmt: 間違いではないのですが、念のためわかりやすいように、killing の後にカッコ書きで(of Yoshichika) を加えました。
tit.e: Tracking down and killing (of Yoshichika) byTAIRA no Masamori

sen.j: 平維衡を祖とする伊勢平氏は伊勢国に地盤を持った武士で、中央では検非違使などとして朝廷の武力として活動していたが、さほど目立った存在ではなかった。
sen.e: Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) whose ancester was TAIRA no Korehira was the bushi (warriors) who was based on Ise Province, and worked as a military force of Chotei, but maintained a low profile.

Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) whose ancestor was TAIRA no Korehira was the bushi (warriors) based on Ise Province, and worked as a military force of Chotei doing kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers), but maintained a low profile.
sen.cmt: 文をすっきりさせるため、who was を削除しました。 訳漏れ：「検非違使などとして」の訳が抜けていたので追加・変更しました。 スペルミス： ancester → ancestor に訂正しました。
sen.e: Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) whose ancestor was TAIRA no Korehira was the bushi (warriors) based on Ise Province, and worked as a military force of Chotei doing kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers), but maintained a low profile.

sen.j: 隠岐守だった平正盛は永長元年（1096年）に白河法皇の皇女媞子内親王を弔う六条院の御堂に伊勢の所領を寄進し、それを期に若狭国守に転じ、法皇から目をかけられるようになっていた。
sen.e: TAIRA no Masamori who was Iki no kuni no kami (Governor of Iki Province) donated his Ise shoryo (territory) to the mido (temple) at Rokujo-in built to perform religious rites for the repose of a soul of Princess Teischi, Imperial Prncess of the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa in 1096, and on that ocassion he moved to Wakasa no kuni no kami (Governor of Wakasa Province), and began to receive favors from the Cloistered Emperor.

TAIRA no Masamori who was Oki no kami (Governor of Oki Province) donated his shoryo (territory) of Ise for a temple at Rokujo-in built to perform religious rites for the repose of a soul of the late Princess Teishi, Imperial Princess of the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa in 1096, and on that occasion he became Wakasa no kuni no kami (Governor of Wakasa Province), and began to receive favors from the Cloistered Emperor.
sen.cmt: 「隠岐守」の訳が"Iki no kuni no kami (Governor of Iki Province)"となっていますが、間違いなので訂正しました。→ Oki no kami (Governor of Oki Province) Ise shoryo はやや英語として不自然な感じがするので、shoryo of Ise に訂正しました。 「六条院の御堂に伊勢の所領を寄進し」の解釈は、おそらく「六条院の御堂を建てるための場所を寄進した」ということだと思い、それに従って訳も訂正しました。 定訳のスペルが間違っていると思われます。次のように訂正しました。Teischi → Teishi スペルミス： Prncess → Princess に訂正しました。 「転じ」は、単に「なった」ということと解釈し、moved to をbecame に訂正しました。 スペルミス： ocassion → occasion に訂正しました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Masamori who was Oki no kami (Governor of Oki Province) donated his shoryo (territory) of Ise for a temple at Rokujo-in built to perform religious rites for the repose of a soul of the late Princess Teishi, Imperial Princess of the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa in 1096, and on that occasion he became Wakasa no kuni no kami (Governor of Wakasa Province), and began to receive favors from the Cloistered Emperor.

sen.j: 嘉承2年（1107年）12月19日、因幡国守だった正盛は、依然として出雲で横行する義親の追討使に任じられた。
sen.e: On December 19, 1107 Masamori who was Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) was appointed as envoy to search and kill Yoshichika who was still looting in Izumo Province.
On December 19, 1107 Masamori who was Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) was appointed as an envoy for tracking down and kill Yoshichika who was still looting in Izumo Province.
sen.cmt: envoy → an envoy に訂正しました。 今までの訳と同様、「追討」はtrack down and kill に変更しました。
sen.e: On December 19, 1107 Masamori who was Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) was appointed as an envoy for tracking down and kill Yoshichika who was still looting in Izumo Province.

sen.j: 出陣にあたり正盛は京都にあった義親の邸宅に向かって三度、鬨の声をあげ、三度、鏑矢を放って出立した（『源平盛衰記』）。
sen.e: On the occasion of his departure to the war, Masamori shouted a battle cry to Yoshichika's mansion three times and shot a whistling arrow to it three times ("Genpei Seisui ki" [Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Taira clans]).

On the occasion of his departure to the war, Masamori shouted a battle cry to Yoshichika's mansion in Kyoto three times and shot a whistling arrow to it three times ("Genpei Seisui ki" [Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Taira clans]).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ：「京都にあった」の部分が抜けていたのでin Kyoto を追加しました。
sen.e: On the occasion of his departure to the war, Masamori shouted a battle cry to Yoshichika's mansion in Kyoto three times and shot a whistling arrow to it three times ("Genpei Seisui ki" [Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Taira clans]).

sen.j: 翌天元 (日本)元年（1108年）正月6日、正盛の軍は出雲国へ到着。
sen.e: On January 6 in the following year (1108), Masamori's army arrived in Izumo Provinnce.
On January 6 in the following year (1108), Masamori's army arrived in Izumo Province.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Provinnce → Province に訂正しました。
sen.e: On January 6 in the following year (1108), Masamori's army arrived in Izumo Province.

sen.j: そして、同月19日、はやくも正盛から義親と従類5人の首を切ったとの戦勝報告が京都へ入った。
sen.e: On January 19 a war victory report of cutting the heads of Yoshichika and his five subordinates was already received by Kyoto.
On January 19, a war victory report of cutting the heads of Yoshichika and his five subordinates was already sent to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 日付の後にコンマを入れました。 received by Kyoto → sent to Kyoto に訂正しました。
sen.e: On January 19, a war victory report of cutting the heads of Yoshichika and his five subordinates was already sent to Kyoto.

sen.j: こうして、義親の乱はあっけなく鎮圧された。
sen.e: In this way Yoshichika's rebellion was ended abruptly.
In this way Yoshichika's rebellion was ended abruptly.
In this way Yoshichika's rebellion was ended abruptly.

sen.j: 合戦の経過は詳らかではないが、鎌倉時代末期成立の『大山寺縁起』によると、義親は蜘戸（雲津浦）に城を築いて立てこもり、正盛は因幡伯耆国出雲三カ国の軍勢を率いて海を渡り、山を越えて、攻め立て、遂に義親を討ち取ったとある。
sen.e: The details of the kassen (battle, engagement) are unknown, but according to "Daisenji engi" (tales of the origin of Daisen-ji Temple) which was completed at the end of the Kamakura period, Yoshichika built a castle at Kumoto (Kumotsuura) and barricaded himself in it, against which Masanori charged leading the troops of three provinces of Inaba, Hoki and Izumo and crossing the sea, and he finally killed Yoshichika.

The details of the kassen (battle, engagement) are unknown, but according to "Daisenji engi" (tales of the origin of Daisen-ji Temple) which was completed at the end of the Kamakura period, Yoshichika built a castle at Kumoto (Kumotsuura) and barricaded himself in it, against which Masanori charged leading the troops of three provinces of Inaba, Hoki and Izumo, crossing the sea and the mountains, and he finally killed Yoshichika.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ：「山を越えて」の部分が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: The details of the kassen (battle, engagement) are unknown, but according to "Daisenji engi" (tales of the origin of Daisen-ji Temple) which was completed at the end of the Kamakura period, Yoshichika built a castle at Kumoto (Kumotsuura) and barricaded himself in it, against which Masanori charged leading the troops of three provinces of Inaba, Hoki and Izumo, crossing the sea and the mountains, and he finally killed Yoshichika.

sen.j: 法皇はこれを喜び、異例にも正盛の帰還を待たずに行賞を行った。
sen.e: The Cloistered Emperor was pleased at this and in an unusual move he conferred an award before Masamori's return to Kyoto.
The Cloistered Emperor was pleased at this and in an unusual move he conferred an award before Masamori's return to Kyoto.
The Cloistered Emperor was pleased at this and in an unusual move he conferred an award before Masamori's return to Kyoto.

sen.j: 正盛は但馬国守、子の平盛康は右兵衛尉、平盛長は左兵衛尉に任じた。
sen.e: He appointed Masamori as Tajime no kuni no kami (governor of Tajima Province), his son, TAIRA no Moriyasu as Uhyoe no jo (officer of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), and another son, TAIRA no Morinaga as Sahyoe no jo (officer of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).

He appointed Masamori as Tajima no kuni no kami (governor of Tajima Province), his son TAIRA no Moriyasu as Uhyoe no jo (officer of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), and another son TAIRA no Morinaga as Sahyoe no jo (officer of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Tajime → Tajima に訂正しました。
sen.e: He appointed Masamori as Tajima no kuni no kami (governor of Tajima Province), his son TAIRA no Moriyasu as Uhyoe no jo (officer of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), and another son TAIRA no Morinaga as Sahyoe no jo (officer of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).

sen.j: 当時の公家の日記『中右記』は「最下品の者が、第一国に任じられたのは院に近侍しているからだろう」との世評を載せている。
sen.e: A diary, "Chuyu-ki" which was written at that time carries the repute that 'the reason for a saigebon (the lowest rank in the nobility) being appointed as Dai-ikkoku might be his serving the Cloistered Emperor closely'.

A diary, "Chuyu-ki" which was written by kuge (a court noble) at that time carries the repute that "the reason for a saigebon (the lowest rank in the nobility) being appointed as Dai-ikkoku might be his serving the Cloistered Emperor closely."
sen.cmt: 「公家の」が抜けているので追加しました。 クオーテーションマークをシングルからダブルに訂正しました。
sen.e: "Chuyu-ki", a diary written by a kuge (court noble) at that time, made reference to a rumor that 'the reason for someone with the rank of saigebon (the lowest rank in the nobility) being appointed to the position of Dai-ikkoku might be that he served the Cloistered Emperor closely.'

sen.j: 正月29日、正盛は京都へ帰着。
sen.e: On January 29, Masomori returned to Kyoto.
On January 29, Masamori returned to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Masomori → Masamori に訂正しました。
sen.e: On January 29, Masamori returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: 義親ら討ち取った者たちの首を掲げて行列を組んで堂々と凱旋した。
sen.e: He and his troops returned with glory parading in lines with the heads of Yoshichika and others upheld.
He and his troops returned with glory parading in lines with the heads of Yoshichika and others upheld.
He and his troops returned with glory parading in lines with the heads of Yoshichika and others upheld.

sen.j: 京の貴賤の人々はこれを見ようと大騒ぎになり、法皇まで車を出して見物に来た。
sen.e: The rich and the poor in Kyoto were greatly excited to look at this and even the Cloistered Emperor came out riding on a kuruma (a small covered 2-wheeled vehicle usually for one passenger).
The rich and the poor in Kyoto were greatly excited to look at this and even the Cloistered Emperor came out riding on a kuruma (a small covered 2-wheeled vehicle usually for one passenger).
The rich and the poor in Kyoto were greatly excited to look at this and even the Cloistered Emperor came out riding on a kuruma (a small covered 2-wheeled vehicle usually for one passenger).

sen.j: 義親の首は七条河原で検非違使に渡され、梟首となった。
sen.e: Yoshichika's head was passed to kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) at Shichijogawara and exposed to the public.
Yoshichika's head was passed to kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) at Shichijogawara and exposed to the public.
sen.cmt: exposed → was exposed に訂正しました。
sen.e: Yoshichika's head was passed to kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) at Shichijogawara and exposed to the public.

tit.e: The internal strife of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan)
The internal strife of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan)
The internal strife of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan)

sen.j: 一旦は義家の嫡子となった義親が追討の対象とされたことで、河内源氏一族には動揺が生じ、遂には深刻な内紛が起こった。
sen.e: Because Yoshichika who was once became a legitimate child was made a subject to be trackeded down and killed, disturbance was generated in Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) and serious internal conflict occurred.
Because Yoshichika who once became a legitimate child of Yoshiie was tracked down and killed, disturbance was generated in Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) and serious internal conflict occurred.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス： was once became → once became に訂正しました。 「義家の」が抜けていたので加えました。 made a subject to be trackeded はスペルミスもあり、英語もやや不自然に思われます。また、原文の「追討の対象とされたことで」は「追討されたことで」と解釈しても良いと考え、訂正しました。
sen.e: The fact that Yoshichika, who had been a legitimate child of Yoshiie, was tracked down and killed caused great unrest among the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), leading to a serious internal conflict within the clan.

sen.j: 義家の遺志により河内源氏の家督は四男の源義忠とされ、義親の長男の源為義がその養子とされた。
sen.e: According to the will of Yoshiie, the family estate of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) was given to his fourth son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitada and Yoshichika's son, MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi was made his adopted son.
According to the will of Yoshiie, the family estate of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) was given to his fourth son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitada and Yoshichika's son, MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi was adopted.
sen.cmt: was made his adopted son → was adopted の方が自然だと考え、訂正しました。
sen.e: According to the will of Yoshiie, the family estate of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) was given to his fourth son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitada and Yoshichika's son, MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi was adopted.

sen.j: 天元2年（1109年）2月、義忠が殺害される事件が起こる。
sen.e: In February, 1109 an incident in which Yoshitada was killed occurred.
In February 1109, an incident in which Yoshitada was killed occurred.
sen.cmt: "In February, 1109" のコンマの位置を変えました。
sen.e: In February 1109, an incident in which Yoshitada was killed occurred.

sen.j: 容疑は義綱にかけられ、憤慨した義綱は一族とともに近江国甲賀に立て籠もった。
sen.e: Yoshitsuna was charged, got angry and barricaded himself and his family at Kaga, Omi Province, against whom Tameyoshi was named to attack, resulting in killing Yoshitsuna's children after a battle and having Yoshitsuna surrender, deported to Sado Province and later kill himself.
Yoshitsuna was charged, got angry and barricaded himself and his family at Kaga, Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 1文で訳すのには無理があるので、3文に分けました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshitsuna was charged, got angry and barricaded himself and his family at Kaga, Omi Province.

sen.j: 為義がこの追討にあたり、合戦の末に義綱の子たちは殺され、義綱は降伏した。
sen.e: Tameyoshi was named to attack Yoshitsuna, killed Yoshitsuna's children after a battle and had Yoshitsuna surrender.
sen.cmt: 3文に分けたため、文を整理するために resulting in killing → killed に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tameyoshi was named to attack Yoshitsuna, killed Yoshitsuna's children after a battle and had Yoshitsuna surrender.

sen.j: 義綱は佐渡国へ流され、後に自害している。
sen.e: Yoshitsuna was deported to Sado Province and later killed himself.
sen.cmt: kill himself → killed himself と時制を訂正しました。
sen.e: Yoshitsuna was deported to Sado Province and later killed himself.

sen.j: 義綱の容疑は冤罪とされ、真相は不明だが『尊卑分脈』などでは義家の弟の義光を真犯人としている。
sen.e: It is said that the charge against Yoshitsuna was a false one, and the truth is unknown although "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), etc. consider Yoshie's younger brother Yoshimitsu as the real criminal.

It is said that the charge against Yoshitsuna was a false one, and the truth is unknown although "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), etc. consider Yoshiie's younger brother Yoshimitsu as the real criminal.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Yoshie's → Yoshiie's に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the charge against Yoshitsuna was a false one, and the truth is unknown although "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), etc. consider Yoshiie's younger brother Yoshimitsu as the real criminal.

sen.j: この同族の内訌によって、河内源氏の力は大きく削がれた。
sen.e: Because of the internal strife in the same family, Kawachi-Genji's power was largely reduced.
Because of the internal strife in the same family, Kawachi-Genji's power declined greatly.
sen.cmt: was largely reduced はやや不自然な感じがするので、declined greatly に訂正しました。
sen.e: Because of the internal strife in the same family, Kawachi-Genji's power declined greatly.

sen.j: 義親追討の「成功」後、白河法皇は源氏に対抗させるように正盛を引き立て昇進させた。
sen.e: After the 'success' in tracking down and killing Yoshichika the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa supported Masamori and promoted him to have him compete with Genji.
After the 'success' in tracking down and killing Yoshichika the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa supported Masamori and promoted him to have him compete with Genji.
After the 'success' in tracking down and killing Yoshichika the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa supported Masamori and promoted him to have him compete with Genji.

sen.j: 山門衆徒の強訴の防禦、強盗の追捕や九州での平直澄の追討などに起用し功を上げさせ、従四位下にまで昇進させた。
sen.e: Letting Masamori gain accomplishments by appointing him for the defense against the direct petition by the monk-soldiers of Sammon gate (temple gate), for searching and capturing robbers, for hunting down and killing TAIRA no Naosumi in Kyushu region, and for others, the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa promoted Masamori to jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

Letting Masamori gain accomplishments by appointing him for the defense against the direct petition by the monk-soldiers of Sammon gate (temple gate), for searching and capturing robbers, for hunting down and killing TAIRA no Naosumi in Kyushu region, and for others, the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa promoted Masamori to jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

Letting Masamori gain accomplishments by appointing him for the defense against the direct petition by the monk-soldiers of Sammon gate (temple gate), for searching and capturing robbers, for hunting down and killing TAIRA no Naosumi in Kyushu region, and for others, the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa promoted Masamori to jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 一方、義親の子の為義は河内源氏の家督は継いだが、祖父が任じられた陸奥守となる願いも許されず、検非違使判官のまま長く留め置かれた。
sen.e: On the other hand Yoshichika's son, Tameyoshi succeeded the reigns of the family of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), but remained as kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) hangan (inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period), rejecting the request to be appointed as the Mutsu no Kami (governer of Mutsu) to which his grand father was appointed.

On the other hand, although Yoshichika's son Tameyoshi succeeded the reigns of the family of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), his request to become Mutsu no Kami (Governor of Mutsu) which his grandfather was, was rejected and he remained as kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) hangan (inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period).
sen.cmt: hangan の前の空白を1半角分削除しました。 Rejecting the request 以降の部分の主語が変わってしまっているので、although を文頭に持ってくることで文全体の構成を変更しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, although Yoshichika's son Tameyoshi succeeded the reigns of the family of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), his request to become Mutsu no Kami (Governor of Mutsu) which his grandfather was, was rejected and he remained as kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) hangan (inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period).

sen.j: 正盛、忠盛父子は海賊の追捕などを経て西国に勢力を扶養し、やがて、平清盛の時代に全盛を迎える。
sen.e: Masamori and his son, Tadamor increased their power in Shikoku region through the capture of pirates and other accomplishments, and eventually TAIRA no Kiyomori's zensei (at the height of its prosperity) came into being.

Masamori and his son Tadamori increased their power in Shikoku region through the capture of pirates and other accomplishments, and eventually TAIRA no Kiyomori's zensei (at the height of its prosperity) came into being.
sen.cmt: his son, Tadamor → his son Tadamori に訂正しました。
sen.e: Masamori and his son Tadamori increased their power in Shikoku region through the capture of pirates and other accomplishments, and eventually TAIRA no Kiyomori's zensei (at the height of its prosperity) came into being.

tit.j: 追討後に現れた4人の「義親」
tit.e: Four 'Yoshichikas' appearing after tracking down and killing him.
Four 'Yoshichikas' who appeared after tracking down and killing Yoshichika.
tit.cmt: appearing → who appeared に訂正しました。 あいまいさを回避するため、最後のhim をYoshichika に置き換えました。
tit.e: Four 'Yoshichikas' who appeared after tracking down and killing Yoshichika.

sen.j: 剛勇で知られた義親がそれまでさしたる武名もなかった正盛に簡単に誅されたことに疑問を持つ者は少なくなかった。
sen.e: Not a few people doubted that Yoshichika who was famed for his bravery was killed so easily by Yoshichika who did not have such military fame.
Not a few people doubted that Yoshichika who was famed for his bravery was killed so easily by Masamori who did not have such military fame.
sen.cmt: 正盛の訳がYoshichika になっているので、Masamori に訂正しました。
sen.e: Not a few people doubted that Yoshichika who was famed for his bravery was killed so easily by Masamori who did not have such military fame.

sen.j: 正盛の武功は疑問とされ、義親生存の噂が流れた。
sen.e: Masamori's military exploits were considered questionable and a rumor of Yoshichika's living was spread.
Masamori's military exploits were considered to be questionable and a rumor of Yoshichika's living was spread.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス： considered questionable → considered to be questionable に訂正しました。
sen.e: Masamori's military exploits were considered to be questionable and a rumor of Yoshichika's living was spread.

sen.j: 永久 (元号)5年（1117年）、義親を名乗る法師が越後国に現れ、豪族平永基の屋敷に出入りした。
sen.e: In 1117 a hoshi (Buddhist priest) who called himself Yoshichika appeared in Echigo Province and visited the mansion of Gozoku (local ruling family), TAIRA no Nagamoto.
In 1117 a hoshi (Buddhist priest) who called himself Yoshichika appeared in Echigo Province and visited the mansion of Gozoku (local ruling family), TAIRA no Nagamoto.
In 1117 a hoshi (Buddhist priest) who called himself Yoshichika appeared in Echigo Province and visited the mansion of Gozoku (local ruling family), TAIRA no Nagamoto.

sen.j: 国司が引き渡しを命じると、永基は法師の首を斬り梟首したが、誰の首かもわからず、永基は検非違使の尋問を受けている。
sen.e: At the order of Kokushi (provincial governor), Nagamoto beheaded the hoshi and exposed his head to the public, but it was not clear whose head was and Nagamoto was questioned by kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers).

At the order of Kokushi (provincial governor), Nagamoto beheaded the hoshi and exposed his head to the public, but it was not clear whose head it was and Nagamoto was questioned by kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers).
sen.cmt: whose head was → whose head it was に訂正しました。
sen.e: At the order of Kokushi (provincial governor), Nagamoto beheaded the hoshi and exposed his head to the public, but it was not clear whose head it was and Nagamoto was questioned by kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers).

sen.j: 翌元永元年（1118年）常陸国に義親を名乗る者が現れた。
sen.e: In the following year (1118), a person who called himself Yoshichika appeared in Hitachi Province.
In the following year (1118), a person who called himself Yoshichika appeared in Hitachi Province.
In the following year (1118), a person who called himself Yoshichika appeared in Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 下総国守源仲政（源頼政の父）が捕縛しようとするが逃げられ、5年後の保安 (日本)4年（1123年）になって下野国で捕えて京都へ送り、検非違使に引き渡した。
sen.e: Shimousa no kuni no kami (Governor of Shimousa Province), MINAMOTO no Nakamasa (the father of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa) tried to capture him, but failed, then five years later (1123) he was captured in Shimotsuke Province, transferred to Kyoto and passed to kebiishi.

Shimousa no kuni no kami (Governor of Shimousa Province), MINAMOTO no Nakamasa (the father of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa) tried to capture him in vain, and five years later (1123) he was captured in Shimotsuke Province, transferred to Kyoto and passed to kebiishi.
sen.cmt: 文をすっきりさせるため、"but failed"の部分を in vain に変更しました。 Then を and に変えました。
sen.e: Shimousa no kuni no kami (Governor of Shimousa Province), MINAMOTO no Nakamasa (the father of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa) tried to capture him in vain, and five years later (1123) he was captured in Shimotsuke Province, transferred to Kyoto and passed to kebiishi.

sen.j: これは白河法皇、鳥羽天皇が実見するまでの騒ぎになったが、結局、義親は既に討滅されているのだからと、この者は偽者とされ梟首された。
sen.e: This became a big incident which made the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba actually see him, but after all he was killed and his head was exposed to the public as a false person since Yoshichika had already extinguished.

This became a big incident which made the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa and the Emperor Toba actually see him, but after all he was killed and his head was exposed to the public as a false person since Yoshichika had already extinguished.
sen.cmt: Emperor Toba → the Emperor Toba に訂正しました。
sen.e: This became a big incident which made the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa and the Emperor Toba actually see him, but after all he was killed and his head was exposed to the public as a false person since Yoshichika had already extinguished.

sen.j: 白河法皇が崩御した大治 (日本)4年（1129年）9月、義親を名乗る者が関東から入洛したとの風聞があった。
sen.e: In1129 when the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa died, there was a rumur that a person who called himself Yoshichika came from Kanto region entered into Kyoto.
In September 1129, when the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa died, there was a rumor that a person who called himself Yoshichika came from Kanto region and entered into Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 9月が抜けていたので追加しました。 スペルミス： rumur → rumor に訂正しました。 Kanto region の後にand を入れました。
sen.e: In September 1129, when the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa died, there was a rumor that a person who called himself Yoshichika came from Kanto region and entered into Kyoto.

sen.j: この者は鳥羽上皇の意向を受けて前関白藤原忠実の鴨院邸に匿われ、「鴨院義親」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: At the intent of the retired Emperor Toba, he was placed in the Kamoin mansion of former chief adviser to the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Tadazane and was called 'Kamoin Yoshichika'.
At the intent of the retired Emperor Toba, he was harbored in the Kamoin mansion of the former chief adviser to the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Tadazane and was called 'Kamoin Yoshichika.'
sen.cmt: "placed" では「匿う」の意味が出ないので、harbored に訂正しました。 former の前に冠詞をつけました。
sen.e: At the intent of the retired Emperor Toba, he was harbored in the Kamoin mansion of the former chief adviser to the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Tadazane and was called 'Kamoin Yoshichika.'

sen.j: 加賀介家定ら旧知の者たちが実見し、大方は別人と証言したが、本物と証言する者もいた。
sen.e: Kaga no suke (Assistant governor of Kaga Province) Iesada and others who knew Yoshichika actually saw him and testified that he was a different person, but some people said that he was real Yoshichika.

Kaga no suke (Assistant governor of Kaga Province) Iesada and others who knew Yoshichika actually saw him and testified that he was a different person, but some people said that he was real Yoshichika.

Kaga no suke (Assistant governor of Kaga Province) Iesada and others who knew Yoshichika actually saw him and testified that he was a different person, but some people said that he was real Yoshichika.

sen.j: しかも、この「鴨院義親」とは別に義親の旧家人の応弁房が義親を熊野で目撃したという噂もあり、生存説は根強かった。
sen.e: Moreover, in addition to this 'Kamoin Yoshichika', there was rumor that a former Kenin (retainer) of Yoshichika had seen him in Kumano area, and there was a strong belief that he was alive.
Moreover, in addition to this 'Kamoin Yoshichika,' there was a rumor that a former Kenin (retainer) of Yoshichika had seen him in Kumano area, and there was a strong belief that he was alive.
sen.cmt: rumor の前に冠詞をつけました。
sen.e: Moreover, in addition to this 'Kamoin Yoshichika,' there was a rumor that a former Kenin (retainer) of Yoshichika had seen him in Kumano area, and there was a strong belief that he was alive.

sen.j: ところが、翌同5年（1130年）近江国大津市に義親を名乗る別の者が現れて入京し、「大津義親」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: However, in 1130, another person calling himself Yoshichika appeared in Otsu, Omin Province, entered into Kyoto and called 'Otsu Yoshichika'.
However, in 1130, another person calling himself Yoshichika appeared in Otsu, Omi Province, entered into Kyoto and was called 'Otsu Yoshichika.'
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Omin → Omi に訂正しました。 and called → and was called に訂正しました。
sen.e: However, in 1130, another person calling himself Yoshichika appeared in Otsu, Omi Province, entered into Kyoto and was called 'Otsu Yoshichika.'

sen.j: 「義親」が二人同時に在京する奇怪な事態となった。
sen.e: It caused a bizarre state of affairs to happen in which two 'Yoshichikas' existed at the same time.
It caused a bizarre state of affairs to happen in which two 'Yoshichikas' existed at the same time.
It caused a bizarre state of affairs to happen in which two 'Yoshichikas' existed at the same time.

sen.j: 同年10月、両者は党類を引き連れて源光信邸前で乱闘となり、「大津義親」が殺された。
sen.e: In October of the same year, the two brought their followers and started a scuffle in front of the mansion of MINAMOTO no Mitsunobur and 'Otsu Yoshichika' was killed.
In October of the same year, the two brought their followers and started a scuffle in front of the mansion of MINAMOTO no Mitsunobu and 'Otsu Yoshichika' was killed.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： Mitsunobur → Mitsunobu に訂正しました。
sen.e: In October of the same year, the two brought their followers and started a scuffle in front of the mansion of MINAMOTO no Mitsunobu and 'Otsu Yoshichika' was killed.

sen.j: 11月、藤原忠実邸（鴨院）に居た「鴨院義親」を騎兵20、従者3-40人が襲撃。
sen.e: In November 20 horse soldiers and 30 to 40 attendants attacked 'Kamoin Yoshichika' who was in the mansion of FUJIWARA no Tadazane (Kamoin).
In November 20 horse soldiers and 30 to 40 attendants attacked 'Kamoin Yoshichika' who was in the mansion of FUJIWARA no Tadazane (Kamoin).
In November 20 horse soldiers and 30 to 40 attendants attacked 'Kamoin Yoshichika' who was in the mansion of FUJIWARA no Tadazane (Kamoin).

sen.j: 「鴨院義親」は党類10人とともに殺された。
sen.e: Kamoin Yoshichika' was killed together with his cabal of 10 people.
Kamoin Yoshichika' was killed together with his cabal of 10 people.
Kamoin Yoshichika' was killed together with his cabal of 10 people.

sen.j: 鳥羽上皇は事件の下手人を捜すよう公卿会議に命じた。
sen.e: The retired Emperor Toba ordered the conference of kugyo (court nobles) to search for the murderer.
The retired Emperor Toba ordered the conference of kugyo (court nobles) to search for the murderer.
The retired Emperor Toba ordered the conference of kugyo (court nobles) to search for the murderer.

sen.j: かつて義親を追討した正盛の子の平忠盛も疑われたが、彼は潔白を主張し、自ら下手人を捕らえると言った。
sen.e: Masamori's son, TAIRA no Tadamori who tracked down and killed Yoshichika was suspected, but he claimed innocence and he insisted that he would capture the murderer on his own.
Masamori's son, TAIRA no Tadamori who tracked down and killed Yoshichika was suspected, but he claimed innocence and he insisted that he would capture the murderer on his own.
Masamori's son, TAIRA no Tadamori who tracked down and killed Yoshichika was suspected, but he claimed innocence and he insisted that he would capture the murderer on his own.

sen.j: 結局、検非違使の源光信が下手人ということにされ（動機は不明）、土佐国へ流された。
sen.e: After all, the kebiishi, MINAMOTO no Mitsunobu was considered as the murderer (the reason unknown), deported to Tosa Province with his younger brother, MINAMOTO no Mitsuyasu removed from his office for conspiration.
After all, the kebiishi, MINAMOTO no Mitsunobu was considered as the murderer (the reason unknown), and was deported to Tosa Province
sen.cmt: 最初の訳では弟の源光保も土佐国へ流されたという誤解を生む可能性があるので、訂正しました。 また、2文に分けました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After all, the kebiishi, MINAMOTO no Mitsunobu was considered as the murderer (the reason unknown), and was deported to Tosa Province

sen.j: 弟の源光保も連座して解官された。
sen.e: His younger brother MINAMOTO no Mitsuyasu was also removed from his office for conspiracy.
sen.cmt: 2文に分けた関係上、 removed → was removed に訂正しました。 「も」に相当する訳が抜けているため、also を加えました。 単語間違い： conspiration → conspiracy に訂正しました。
sen.e: His younger brother MINAMOTO no Mitsuyasu was also removed from his office for conspiracy.

sen.j: この事件はかつて白河法皇が追討させた大罪人の義親を名乗る人物を、鳥羽上皇が藤原忠実に保護させ、更にこの罪人を殺した者を賞するどころか罰したなど、不審な点が多い。
sen.e: Regarding this incident there are many causes to suspect foul play such as the retired Emperor Toba's protection given to Yoshichika who was a serious criminal whom the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa had tracked down and killed and furthermore not rewarding but punishing the person who killed this criminal.

This incident has many suspicious points: the retired Emperor Toba had FUJIWARA no Tadazane protect a person calling himself Yoshichika, who was a serious criminal whom the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa had tracked down and killed; and furthermore the retired Emperor punished the person who killed this criminal instead of giving him a reward.
sen.cmt: 一文が長く、非常にわかりにくい文章になっているため、コロンを使うなどして大幅に訂正しました。また、「藤原忠実に保護させ」の部分が訳漏れでしたので、追加して訂正しました。
sen.e: This incident has many suspicious points: the retired Emperor Toba had FUJIWARA no Tadazane protect a person calling himself Yoshichika, who was a serious criminal whom the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa had tracked down and killed; and furthermore the retired Emperor punished the person who killed this criminal instead of giving him a reward.
